Color.description:
Represents a color in RGBA space.
The Color namespace provides helper functions to work with
[Color](#Color) literals.

alpha.description: The alpha component of this color in the range [0-1].

blue.description: The blue component of this color in the range [0-1].

green.description: The green component of this color in the range [0-1].

red.description: The red component of this color in the range [0-1].

Position.description:
Position in a text document expressed as zero-based line and character offset.
The offsets are based on a UTF-16 string representation. So a string of the form
`a𐐀b` the character offset of the character `a` is 0, the character offset of `𐐀`
is 1 and the character offset of b is 3 since `𐐀` is represented using two code
units in UTF-16.

Positions are line end character agnostic. So you can not specify a position that
denotes `\r|\n` or `\n|` where `|` represents the character offset.
The Position namespace provides helper functions to work with
[Position](#Position) literals.

character.description:
Character offset on a line in a document (zero-based). Assuming that the line is
represented as a string, the `character` value represents the gap between the
`character` and `character + 1`.

If the character value is greater than the line length it defaults back to the
line length.

decimal.description:
Defines a decimal number. Since decimal numbers are very
rare in the language server specification we denote the
exact range with every decimal using the mathematics
interval notations (e.g. [0, 1] denotes all decimals d with
0 <= d <= 1.

uinteger.description: Defines an unsigned integer in the range of 0 to 2^31 - 1.

description:
Represents a color range from a document.
The ColorInformation namespace provides helper functions to work with
[ColorInformation](#ColorInformation) literals.

color.description: The actual color value for this color range.

range.description: The range in the document where this color appears.
